Detailed Description

cvmx_mio_ptp_ckout_thresh_hi

This register contains the high bytes of the PTP CKOUT threshold. Writes to MIO_PTP_CKOUT_THRESH_HI also clear MIO_PTP_CKOUT_THRESH_LO; in order to update all 96 bits, writes MIO_PTP_CKOUT_THRESH_HI followed by MIO_PTP_CKOUT_THRESH_LO. This threshold [MIO_PTP_CKOUT_THRESH_HI, MIO_PTP_CKOUT_THRESH_LO] is a rolling threshold that will be updated by hardware: When current PTP_CKOUT before inversion (defined by MIO_PTP_CLOCK_CFG[CKOUT_INV]) is zero, and [MIO_PTP_CLOCK_HI/LO] >= [MIO_PTP_CKOUT_THRESH_HI/LO], the pre-inverted PTP_CKOUT will update to one, and [MIO_PTP_CKOUT_THRESH_HI/LO] will increment by MIO_PTP_CKOUT_HI_INCR. When current PTP_CKOUT before inversion (defined by MIO_PTP_CLOCK_CFG[CKOUT_INV]) is one, and [MIO_PTP_CLOCK_HI/LO] >= [MIO_PTP_CKOUT_THRESH_HI/LO], the pre-inverted PTP_CKOUT will update to zero, and [MIO_PTP_CKOUT_THRESH_HI/LO] will increment by MIO_PTP_CKOUT_LO_INCR.
